Key Match Events: Jos Buttler scored a sensational 73, having been twice dropped
Jos Buttler moved past Eoin Morgan as England's leading run-scorer in T20I cricket with 2,468 runs
Sam Curran took a huge catch to dismiss Jimmy Neesham for 6
Tim Southee bowled Ben Stokes LBW for 8 in the penultimate ball of the innings
Ben Stokes briefly left the field after aggravating his troublesome left index finger
Post-Match Reflections: England has kept its T20 World Cup hopes alive with a tense, 20-run victory over New Zealand
Stokes helped halt the avalanche of runs when he had Williamson caught for a run-a-ball 40 by Rashid
Jimmy Neesham (6) followed shortly after when he was caught by Curran on the square leg boundary off the bowling of Wood
Miscellaneous Highlights: The result means everything rests on the final round of matches in group one, with England second, behind New Zealand and ahead of Australia on net run rate
The Gabba drew a healthy crowd of 22,547 fans
The clouds spent themselves by mid-afternoon and the perfect playing conditions ended up drawing a healthy crowd of 22,547 fans to the Gabba
Phillips' innings saw him reach his 50 off 25 balls
Phillips holed out to Jordan for a superb 62 off just 36 balls
